ratings.comment: Ever hear of a lesson plan? That keeps teachers on track so they know what they are doing each day, and fairly evaluate students. This is exactly the folly of PhDs with no degree in education. Even a 100 hour teaching seminar before they are hired would be of great use. You'd think an institution of higher education would've figured that out.

Professor Loewenstein was a pain at the beginning of the semester, but as time went on I started to appreciate her teaching style. She is disorganized and changes things frequently and she's old school, but she is a very skilled lecturer and you will learn a LOT, and has many years of experience in the Middle East. I recommend her.
Do yourself a favor and stay clear of this professor.
AVOID AT ALL COSTS. WORST PROFESSOR.

This is a professor who's person liberal opinion clearly trumps facts, current events, and accurate historical account.  Mrs. Lowenstein comes across as an obvious (and sometimes insulting) attempt at academic indoctrination.  suggestion....... stay away.

She's extremely disorganized and goes off on very long tangents in lecture. When she does talk about course material it's very interesting, but you don't need to go to lectures to get As on exams. You can learn it all by yourself very easily.

Jennifer is the most disorganized professor I have ever had. She has no structure in her lectures whatsoever and actually admitted 5 weeks into the course that she hadn't looked at the syllabus since the first day of class. You will never know what's going on or what she is talking about due to constant rambling and getting off topic.

This was the worst class I have ever taken. I thought it would be interesting, but Jennifer is horrible. She is extremely disorganized. Assignment due dates constantly change, so it is hard to pay attention because it is so scattered. It is an easy a at least. I learned more by spending the lectures on BBC reading about the middle east.

I totally do not understand why UW still hires her. The MOST disorganized class ever. She expects students to know way much more than what she teaches. You need to read the book, learn through the book by yourself and write an essay.

Like every other comment before this, she knows a lot about the Middle East but is just an awful teacher/lecturer. Like my god, we're 9 lectures in and have taken less than 1/2 a page of notes. She gets off topic so often it absolutely ridiculous. Do not take this class unless it's absolutely required. It's just not worth it.

At first, I dreaded going to this class. However, as the class went on, I began to understand her teaching method. I grew to love Loewenstein and even her disorganized ways. I got an A in the class and while I had no interest in the middle east prior to the course, I have gained total interest, and hope to go to Lebanon this summer. Take the class!

Jennifer is a very knowledgeable person on the Middle East, but she is the most disorganized professor I have ever had. Never got our quizzes back! You never know how you're doing in the class. Lecture is hard to follow because she just sits there and talks at you. There were no powerpoints or anything. I was very disappointed with this course.

The worst professor I have had.  She is extremely disorganized and her lectures are impossible to follow. Don't just take this class just because it is easy, she will drive you crazy! She is late to every class, due dates and test dates are always changing, and she can never remember what she has already told us.

She's not very organized, but her class is very easy. I mostly zoned out in class and read the book for information for the exams. Go to review sessions, give you all the info you need. Got an A without much work.

really helpful class, learned things i never knew about the middle east. she isn't the most organized professor, changes dates around, etc; in the end, it's a really easy A. go to the review session at the end of each of the 2 units; she pretty much tells you, word for word, what to write during the exam, which were both essays she gave in advance!

She really knows her stuff, but she has a bit of trouble conveying it sometimes. Lectures are unorganized as she jumps all over the place, but the material is very interesting. If you read the textbook closely, though, you should have no problem at all.
We jam out to music for 15 minutes after she shows up 15 minutes late for class...good music though :)

Terrible class. I think she may be quite knowlegdeable on the material, but she does not know how to teach!! Her class put into one word is irritating.  She moves slow, talks slow, and writes slow.   The grading of the exams is fairly easy though, which is the only upside to the class.

BAHH! Biased opinions and monotonic speaker. always shows up late to class. definitely NOT organized. keeps repeating the same stuff again and again. shes very nice but she gotta do something about her bias-ness and disorganization! the EASIEST class ever though ... I maybe studied an average of half an hour a week and ended up with an A.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! Jennifer is a terrible lecturer and you will just get frustrated with this class. Biggest waste of time in my life. Not even worth it for an easy grade. Trust me!

Terrible professor, but the class isn't too hard. Just read the Cleveland text and you'll be fine. Lecture is boring and she rambles on constantly about meaningless random thoughts, but it is also mandatory so you have to go, good luck not sleeping. Overall, take the class if you have to otherwise find something else!

Absolutely terrible. I love learning about the middle east by this class is useless, she says she is organized, but she is NOT. Unless you are required to take this course, DO NOT TAKE  IT. Some say this because they get a bad grade, I got a good grade but I cannot stand this class.

This class is seriously a joke. Please save yourself a headache and do not take it. I am sitting in class right now listening to her drone on and on about a useless topic when all the information is in the book, I just want to learn something, but I evidently haven't.

This class was a waste of my time and money. The only info from lectures were how to answer the questions. The prof was routinely late and she rambled on points that did not matter. If you are trying to get a Certificate in M.E. Studies take the class, otherwise if you are just interested or want to learn, take a different class!
Extremely boring and pointless lectures.

This class was easy and had a low work load. The texts were interesting and I enjoyed the topics but the lectures were very boring. The teacher rambles and repeats in the poorly structured lectures. Only the cleveland text was necessary to use

We had to buy 7 books for this class and I never opened 4 of them. She goes over the same things and expects you to read a lot but changes the required readings daily. She also will reschedule class so it meets for 3 hours instead of the normal power lecture. Extra Credit is offered. Overall she was biased and she tells her life storys a lot

To say she is kind of bias is like to say the Holocaust was kind of sad. I have never seen a professor so biased in my years at Madison. I learned a lot in this class because I read the text book, but Jeniffer is the worst professor on this campus; it is unfortunate that so many students have to be subject to her ridiculous style of teaching

I just took the class for the credits, but I ended up learning a lot and it was really easy. She wants you to read a TON but you really don't need to. She is very scatterbrained and random, but if you can deal with that and the fact that she's kind of bias, it's a fun and easy class!

Yes, it is obvious she is a biased teacher- she will tell you that herself.  However, her bias isn't what I would say is 'normal' in the US, so it was interesting to hear the other side of the debate.  She does her best to give you numbers and facts as background information and also brings in locals from the conflict area to give their account.

Loewenstein is not a good teacher. The class is absurdly easy but you only learn her perverse view of the Middle East. If you are interested in Middle East studies and actually want to do some serious scholarship, do not take her class. If you want an easy A, by all means, take this woman's class. I warn you, she is extremely biased.
